review: Today we went to this Livonia location "Red Robin" & everything that could go wrong did go wrong!! Our server dropped the food off and NEVER came back to check on us!**(when we first sat down the salt and pepper shakers were greasy, grimey and gross!.. I asked him to wipe them off... Then I could Not get a refill for my diet coke for anything.. He wouldn't even look over at us !!! Finally this other waitress came near enough to us that's we just asked her to get our waiters attention!! Soooo she then instead asked us what we needed..we said we just wanted drink refills! She offered to bring them for us!!!! She then never came back until finally she came again and said "oh what are you drinking?? " We told her a soda and a water... This time she really never came back and neither did our assigned waiter!! Sooo finally we asked some random staff for a manager to come over to us,& the managers name was. "Megan"...she was kind,apologetic and everything nice!!! At that point just actually getting our drinks before we "keeled over" from thirst was all we wanted! Megan made sure we got our drinks and she comp'd our meal(which that was NOT what we were after .. We just wanted her to know that the waiter dropped out food off and never came back!!!)..she was so nice and that Made us feel much better just to know someone actually cared!!  Thank You!  Megan!!  Soooo.....after much re-consideration and after the way we were treated so great by the manager, "Megan"...we decided that we will go back and give it another try! She was really great and really good at what she does!! Good Job Red Robin!!

This restaraunt is very clean and the food is awesome. The waitress, Sarena, performed way above expections.  My nephew had turned 21.  We had 12 people in our party.  Sarena made sure that everyone had plenty to drink.  Getting a refill on drinks is a consistent problem at all other Red Robin locations.   Serena got all of our orders correct, cleared empty plates and glasses from our table and even brought out serving plates for the birthday cake we brought with us.   In fact, a manager came by our table just to make sure we were doing well. Sarena, there is a great future ahead of you no matter where you go to work.  Your  positive attitude and attention to detail will serve you well.

This was my first trip to a Red Robin to eat. I liked it! I ordered a simple Cheeseburger with steak fries. It came out quickly, was cooked to my request and it was delicious. I love that they wrap them in paper too, it's a nice touch keeping the sandwich all together and not in your lap ; ) The steak fries are your standard breed but the seasoning salt on the table is again, an added touch. Service from Michelle was great...friendly, and quick for refills with a big smile. I need to be a little more adventurous next trip and I'll definitely give them another try.

Staff was good with our crowd on a busy Friday lunch.  Asked me when they had a question about my special order which was nice.  I liked having a veggie alternative to fries (yeah it sucks but I need to lose weight).  The lettuce for no bun option is nice.  I left off one start just cause the super busy tacky dining room décor and it's run good  but it's a chain so nothing over the top in uniqueness.

I really love going to Red Robin. The food is always good and this location has great wait staff. I am vegetarian so the fact that I can get a yummy noon meat burger is a plus. We try to go here often, but we still want it to be special so we limit our visits to maybe once every other month.

Stopped at Red Robin last night. Never again! Asked for a burger medium and it came almost completely red on the inside. Told the waitress I asked for medium. She said your right it's very rare. Brought back another, after my wife was finished with her dinner - not much better, that was in three pieces and barely cookedany better than the first. A few bites and they can keep it! How they got a Zagat rating is beyond me. NEVER AGAIN!

Red Robin is a high-energy, casual restaurant popular with families. On any typical evening, you may see groups celebrating birthdays, watching sports, or enjoying a good meal in a fun environment.   While there are over a dozen different burgers on the menu, the Banzai burger is my go-to choice. With grilled pineapple slices and sweet Teriyaki sauce, the medium rare burger was juicy and delicious. To minimize calories, I enjoyed the burger wrapped in lettuce leaves, instead of the sesame seed bun, and without the mayo. This burger tends to be very messy so I tend to order it with half the sauce, enough for flavor without compromising the overall taste of the burger. Burgers come with bottomless steak fries but can be substituted with other items, such as salad (at no extra cost), sweet potato fries ($1), or soup ($2). The sweet potato fries are definitely worth the extra price/calories. One of the main attractions is the vast beverage menu. The freckled lemonade, lemonade with sweetened strawberries, is always a tempting treat. I also love the root beer float, made with soft serve, and the milk shake. I am craving them as I write this. Too bad it is close to midnight or I would be out the door. Sign up for their loyalty program and enjoy freebies, such as a free burger on your birthday and every tenth burger free. Surprise treats are also communicated throughout the year - all great reasons for joining. Recent examples include: - Free small order of onion rings, with $10 minimum purchase - 50% off burger, with $10 minimum purchase - Free gingerbread shake, with $10 minimum purchase Service is friendly and prompt and should be a role model for other restaurants.

For the love of my son... Lol Banzai burger meh.. The pineapple was cool and should have tasted char grilled. You really don't taste the burger.   Fries were good especially with dipping sauce but that's not to be the main draw. Hubs enjoyed the tortilla soup and also felt meh about the royal burger. The burger patties are lacking something... Son's chicken strips were quite yummy and seem to be an improvement over last time. Hostess was friendly. Waitress was busy and we didn't see here after our meal was delivered until just at the end and we had to request refills of beverages.

Red Robin is our go to for a burger, it's a great chain and close by.  We often frequent RR for their happy hour (half price apps and drink specials).  They have a great selection of burgers that you can order or customize your own.  I often try different burgers and haven't had a bad one, I get a wheat bun or no bun and sometimes do the sweet potato fries--- can't go wrong with the bottomless steak fries.  Sometimes it's hit or miss on how it is cooked (I prefer medium) but for the most part they are consistent on this and their service is on point.  Don't forget to ask for the frequency card if you go here a lot or with a large group, you get the 9 or 10th burger free and a free burger coupon on your birthday.   We haven't really tried any of the other food options other than burgers.  We keep coming back since the service is awesome and the food is great for a chain.
For the price point was a great experience the manager stop by once during dinner and again as we were leaving out the front door. You guys have to ask for the server Christie she's a rock star
Noisy kid environment with a ton of burger choices!   The bottomless fries are good and the dipping sauces make them even better.

I like Red Robin for larger get togethers. I often eat here with a group of friends after a long day. The staff is friendly and the there is something on the menu for everybody- including gluten free and vegetarian options!  The food is your typical American fare and the decorations are a bit tacky, but I always have fun when dining at Red Robin!

Worst service I've ever had, will never return. The waitresses need more training on interacting with customers and less with coworkers. This restaurant is literally a joke compared to other red robins.

I haven't been to one in ages, but looks like they now have sweet potato fries and bottomless root beer floats... I went with my default sandwich, the chicken teriyaki with sweet potato fries... the fries were crispy and good....  As for service, it was little slow and the place wasn't that busy.... it took them a while to refill my water cup... on this visit, it seemed like everyone there was there to celebrate their birthday... in the 45 minutes I was there, the staff members sang happy birthday to six people.... and yes, it was noisy on this visit.

Worst thin dry overcooked burgers, worst slowest service, rude servers and manager also!   Acted like they couldn't be bothered with customers, even at other tables and I was so nice.  Brought me wrong tea and huffed when she had to bring the correct one back which took 10 minutes and slammed it down on table and walked away without asking if food was okay. I had to call her back to tell her burger was well done instead of medium.   Loudest restaurant ever!  Cannot believe they stay in business! Oh, and was so slow that they never brought us more fries!  Terrible in every way!  Never went back and never will!  Eat here at your own risk!  Trust me!  Max and Erma's or Ruby Tuesdays have the best burgers around with kind and quick service!!!!
Love this place. Great food and great stuff come here a lot on Sunday's after church. Love it
If you are looking for a great burger and fries this is the place to go.  The Black and Bleu is my fave but the bonsai is great also.  The herb fries are amazing.

This is the worst experience at a Red Robin Restaurant I have had. I will not be back to this location. The service from the host staff and management does not usually constitute a bad experience at a restaurant, but there is a first for everything.

Red Robin Gourmet Burgers ..... I can guarantee you there was nothing "gourmet" about my experience today. From start to finish it was completely dissatisfying. My guy and I dined here after a movie at Pheonix Theatres across the street. After having poor service there (we will not get into it!) we were both hungry and looking forward to a good meal. He decided on Red Robin because it was so conveniently located. We were seated promptly at a booth and our waitress took out drink order right away. Always a good sign, right? She then came back every minute (or less!) until we got our dinner order ready. We both don't normally dine at Red Robin, much less are familiar with their menu. Their name said "gourmet burgers" so we both took that as a good sign and ordered, well, burgers. We also ordered an appetizer of chili cheese fries to split.  I barely had a chance to open my straw from it's wrapper before our appetizer was on our table. To be honest, it was the saddest looking concoction of chili cheese fries ever. Half of the cheese was melted, half of it wasn't. Fries itself were not fully cooked and the meat .... let's just say I'm not feeling so great since.  Within 30 seconds of our appetizer being presented to us our dinners were also served as well. My biggest pet peeve is when your meal comes out right after getting the appetizer. If I'm ordering an appetizer, I expect to enjoy a bit of it before enjoying the meal that I ordered.  If only you could have seen the look on my face after eyeing my cheeseburger. It was not love at first sight, let me tell you. A Big Mac from McDonald's looked more appealing than whatever I was served. I wasn't aware you could screw up a burger so badly. The sesame bun was pale, not toasted, and already falling apart on the plate. The well done meat patty I asked for? Was definitely pink instead, in addition to cut in half. The half of burger patty fell out of the bun the second I picked it up! The bottomless fries with my burger? I found a handful that were still frozen. My man had similar issues with his meal. How about instead of rushing out people's food, you make sure it's fully cooked instead. Just a suggestion.  The whole situation made us both uncomfortable and made it seem like our service wasn't welcome. The place itself was fairly slow, yet we were somehow getting rushed all throughout our experience. Getting our entire meal after only being in the restaurant for maybe 10 minutes? No thank you. Our waitress (and others on the staff) were too busy talking to friends at other tables to even notice we were unhappy.  I will not be returning to this establishment anytime soon. If you want a cheaply made burger at a high cost, I suggest coming here. If not, McDonald's or Burger King make burgers better than the ones served here. Better yet, look elsewhere for a better dining experience. You be the judge.

We were celebrating a daughters 18th birthday with family tonight Friday 9-4-15. This place was rather busy but I don't believe the staff had much direction. Cocktails took too long to arrive. Empty glasses were not removed when serving fresh beverages. We ordered an appetizer which was rather cool, tower of onion rings, so they were probably in window too long. It took forever to get our soups which were served luke warm at best. Unfortunately we also were served our entrees at the exact same time from the other end of the table. Hmmmm what do I choose to eat hot and what to eat cold??  I chose the soup which was cold anyway. The prime rib dip was my entree of choice. The girl bringing the food wanted me to reach over three people to retrieve my dinner but I kept my hands in my lap. So she brought the plate down and reach between me and another and managed to spill the sandwich au jus on my lap before reaching the table.  At no point was an attempt made to clear appetizer plates or glassware and we are being served the cake we brought cluttered now with our dinner plates and everything from earlier. Eventually a few plates were removed but first we had stacked them to make room for ourselves and then suggested that our "server" do some cleaning.  We sat in back by the bar which is fine for our group of 6 but I never saw a manager, I wasn't given a chance to ask for a redo on any part of my cold dry meal. As I had been at the Westland location just last week with a member of tonight's party the only thing my guest could say was I'm sorry. Your meal looks old and dry. It looked nothing like what she had last week.  I'm not sure what is so hard about this concept and its ability to train good help but I'll need to see some positive reviews before I spend another $150.00.
Best, best best.. The bottomless fries. The thai sauce in the burger, the burger with pineapples. OMG... Just super and lovely..

More fries please!  More fries please! We all know that you get more of those great steak fries but their burgers and chicken burgers are pretty good too. My favorite and I had another one here is the Rajun' Cajun Chicken Burger. What a great taste with the pepper jack cheese and cajun spices. This was a great sandwich here again. Keeps me coming back. The service was great again.
The food is good and the customer service is great. I always go here. The unlimited fries is good. The buffalo clucks r good. The burgers are good.

Bottomless fries? Check. Regular drink refills? Check. Awesome burgers? Check. These are the reasons why I love Red Robin. This one is more than consistent, it hits the mark every time, in comparison to other Red Robin locations. It's always clean, the service is always on point and the food is always consistent and solid. It gets busy and noisy sometimes, but I don't really pay heed to that since the food and quality service are always good. My personal pick is the Cajun burger, I never ever go wrong with it. My girlfriend orders the veggie whenever we eat at RRGB and she says it's good, but she really loves the fries.

I wish I could remember our servers name, but she was amazing!!  She was patient when we stalled to order because a guest was not there yet, but still extremely attentive.  Food is always great!  I never realized how many options they have for kid meals - made me jealous!

Our server tonight was terrible. I got half way down with my burger and realized it was rare when I wanted it med well. I told her and she told me I will tell them so they know for next time. My gf gave me the rest of her food so that I had something to eat. Come on servers its customer service. It's not going to end your career
Good burgers nothing really to go bat shit crazy about I like the Rajen Cajun chicken sandwich and I like this place better than most chain restaurant's.....

Ordered some items, including a side grilled caesar salad, to go...when I got home I found out they gave me an unwashed head of lettuce with some cheese on top...WTF!!! am I supposed to cut the lettuce and make my own salad???...I'm going to take it back...

I've been coming to this location for a number of years now. It's really not bad, but I feel that they've been sliding in the food department lately. Not the choice of the location, I don't believe, but probably from corporate. The food is getting smaller and smaller! I like the seafood scatter. It used to be very filling...not so much any more! I had a burger, fries, & a side salad today, wife had the same thing. It was good, burger prepared as requested, the fries a little extra crispy like we wanted, salad fresh, and our waitress trainee did a great job! She actually let us finish our food BEFORE bringing the check! This is unusual for Red Robin! I once had the check when I was only 1/2 finished with my food...literally! "No rush, I'll take that up when you're ready"... I ordered another beer just to screw them up. They used to have a "No kids allowed zone" by the bar. I LOVED this. There should be a spot like this in every restaurant. Not that I don't like kids...I do, a lot!.. but sometimes when you're wound up, on edge, and just want to relax with a cold one and a burger and take a nice long exhale...a screaming little darling behind your head doesn't help! (I really don't want you to think I hate kids!) ANYWAY...they took the no kid zone away! PLEASE put it back...I promise I'll add a star if you do! Now they do have a lot of young servers and sometimes the service is better than others,(maybe the young servers couldn't go into the no kids zone?) but overall through the years it's been pretty good. The food, although shrinking, is consistent and decent. Hell...I wouldn't keep coming if it wasn't. You can get out of the place without spending an arm and a leg, too. Get there during happy hour & you'll be in heaven. It'd be even better if the "no kids zone" was back! Seriously...PLEASE put it back...PLEASE! I'll even add 2 stars maybe...we can negotiate!

we have come here and we ordered at 8:50 and our food didn't come out till 9:30, the dessert come out before the order of fries. The food comes out extremely cold the wings come out piled with onion chips to hide the fact that there were only 3 in there and when brought to the managers attention she didn't really seem to care and she had brought out some more fries and they came out just as cold as the first ones very poor service we didn't even know who our waitress was they switched shortly after arriving and the 2nd one never introduced herself till 20 mins later 4/9/16 arrived at 8:40 p.m.

The hostess was rude when we requested a booth verses a table stated "that the area was closed but at the same time another hostess sat someone in the same section. I'm very disappointed with the initial service we recived spoke with Adam the manager on duty at the time and he provided no solutions for us and took the 15 minutes for him to come and talk to us.

After many service problems at the Westland Red Robin, we started coming here instead. We've only dined in a couple of times, and the service seemed just fine. No real attitudes (although the hosts always seem a little distracted with talking among themselves or with other employees, and sometimes they seem a little tired and fed up). Not yet, anyway. Girl on the phone doesn't sound as irritated as the one in Westland sometimes did, although I do get a sense that they want the call over with as soon as heavenly possible, even when they aren't remotely busy. The few times that we did sit down inside here, however, our service wasn't nearly as frustrating as it was in Westland. With that said... we almost never sit inside the restaurant. We order take-out meals, check it before we leave, then eat it at home. And the food itself always rocks. That's all I care about if I'm eating it at home. We do have to take a longer trip to get here than we did to get to Westland, but since the percentage of "wrong orders" has been very, very low here so far, we're willing to drive farther to get it. We still order the same food we always do. The burgers come out just how we ask for them. There's never been an issue with them, and we've purchased food from here about fifteen times or so, possibly more. There has rarely, if ever, been an issue with our food being wrong or cooked incorrectly. Even if the service is poor, we're not there to deal with it. Never received a wrong order yet. Sometimes they don't listen when I say "I want a side of ranch" on the phone and I have to ask for it when I get there, a second time. But they hand it over immediately when I ask inside the establishment. As long as I get it, I'm good. I've eaten several signature Red Robin burgers of all kinds, and I've never had one that was bad. Although I wouldn't go so far as to call them "gourmet". They do taste great. But not that great. I will mark the day I actually do ever eat a "gourmet burger," but in my life, it hasn't really happened yet. Most burgers have similar tastes to them, and unless you can toss the meat in your own homemade spice-sauce blend before grilling, and create your own special mayonnaise spread from scratch, and have the freshest vegetables imaginable and a shelf full of the best seasonings, a cheeseburger isn't really a "gourmet" meal. But let's be honest. If you wanted gourmet, you'd go to Fiamma Cafe, not a burger restaurant. That doesn't mean the meal shouldn't be cooked to the utmost perfection that you can make it, but when it comes to gourmet food, I have tastes other than classic American food. When I do want classic American food... this isn't a bad first choice.
Burgers burgers!!! Nice place to have a meal once in a while... The fries just keep coming ... That's the best part!!!

First time at Red Robin.  The service was excellent (Dion our server made our experience a great one!) and the food was delicious.  I am only giving this 4 stars because I found my french onion soup to be extremely salty.

BOI This restraunt is one of the most underrated places in the world. Thats fact. These botomless fries are bomb. The milkshakes are delicious. You get that campfire sauce and that steak spice going and you are in for a good time. I visit this restraunt about once every 2 months and the service is always great and the food is always amazing.
Friday night, busy I understand.... order was wrong, undercooked and cold. Sent it back, received an even more disgusting warmed up version of what I sent back.  Too bad, been here many times.

Great dinner tonight at Red Robin. We were seating immediately in a spacious booth. Pretty good for the price and the bottomless fries and broccoli are amazing. Not quite upscale, but nice enough. Our server was great but I can't remember her name. Will definitely be returning!
This restaurant has the best food but there service is terrible we have waited 30 minutes for 2 chicken tenders that were cold and baby size. This needs to improve.

Red Robin never let's us down. Beers were ice cold. We had two cheeseburgers cooked perfectly. We also had onion rings and fries as side. Only suggestion would be more onion rings per serving. Everyone go. Eric our server was tremendous!

Not the best not the worst.  Service was OK - took a while to get our waters/beers when we sat down.  The burgers are always good and the restaurant is clean. Red Robin is just your average chain restaurant - don't expect to be blown away.  We will continue to keep dining here as it's a good option if you're craving a decent burger. My one complaint would be the fries - although bottomless, if you don't season them they are still sub-par.   I received 2 baskets of fries both were without seasoning.   I feel this could be quickly fixed. Also, having the beer list on the wall opposite of the bar seems like poor placement, but I'm not interior decorator.
Came here after a long time. Premium quality burgers. I usually like spicy and this place has chicken burgers with perfect spice and flavor. Bottomless fries are my favorite.
The food was just ok. The prices aren't bad but I felt overpriced for the value. The place is very family friendly... it seemed like every table had children at it.

This was a great experience! I had the bacon cheeseburger and it was AWESOME. Best burger I have had in awhile. The endless fries were on point as always and piping hot.  My coworker got the all American and said it was great. He was a little confused as to why it didn't come on a bun but he said it was a great meal.

Good food had Pepper Burger and Bonzi Wings, both where outstanding. Waited awhile for the food but was sitting in bar so watching sports. Bartender wasn't very friendly and staff stood around complaining a lot. When trying to relax after work myself not what I want to hear. Good food bad experience. Hopefully when you try your experience is different.

Being here couple of times, very consistent quality burgers. My wife love the Cajun chicken one, well balanced flavor with juicy and tender chicken. I like the regular beef burger, rich flavor with right cooked patty (I like medium) other details are good too: sweet potato fries and Onion rings ( I know it is not healthy,  but..) are prepared with perfect crispy texture and well selected ingredients.  I give it four stars, because they are good but nothing outstanding found.

Five out of our last six take out orders had errors in them. Some as simple as not putting a side sauce in the bag; some as big as getting fries as a side instead of the salad that was ordered. Their problem is systemic with the person boxing up our order blaming the kitchen and I'm sure the kitchen would just blame the person boxing the order. Management just sends us a gift card each time to make up for it, which doesn't solve the problem. If basic operational processes can't be followed, how can you trust anything else here. Tried to email but of course no email address for the franchisee or for corporate is available. Trying social media.

Great food but terrible experiences with take out.  Last time I called, waited on hold for 7 minutes to be transferred to the bar, hung up and called again.  They said "oh, I'll see if I scan get him to answer".  Huh?  Wait another 5 minutes, hang up.  Try a third time and finally get through.  Order was correct, but had to wait 20 minutes after the time they said it would be ready. This time, got through with only one attempt.  And order was ready on time.  But made the mistake of trusting the bag they brought me and I didn't check it.  Get it home, all of the desserts are missing. So like I said, great food.  But having to put up with the headaches of takeout there makes sure we don't use them very often.
My wife and 2 kids ate here and my wife got food poisoning from a Chicken sandwich.  This is the second day and still not good.  Avoid at all costs.

Ordered a southwest salad, dysfunctional staff lost it, eventually found it, brought it out missing half the ingredients so it was just a chicken breast with lettuce and tomatoes no black beans, grilled vegetables, nor jalapeños. Especially disappointing meal on a Friday night.

Let me put it this way. It felt like God cut out my stomach and placed it in the most holy divine place imaginable. Pure bliss. Kyle, are waitor, had the face of an angel and checked on us like a mother does to her child. He gave me the greatest burger I have ever placed my eyes upon. I didn't know if I should cry, or thank him. I ended up doing both. He seemed confused, but he understood where I was coming from as he set the heavenly plate in front of my ready to recieve mouth. I will never forget this day as it will go down as the greatest day I ever experienced.       Sincerely,               A happy heart.

Red Robin gourmet burgers more like below average burgers the fact they say gourmet for these burgers is sad I had ordered the royal which is just a single patty burger with egg bacon tomato and onions on it.I asked for it to be cooked to medium. It definitely was well done equaling dry. Also my fries were cold originally the next batch they brought out were hot. Definitely do not need to go back here any time soon

This place was really great. This was my first time coming and let's just say I am impressed. So many burgers to choose from and if you don't eat beef don't fret they have chicken fish and pasta to choose from also. Now that I have a family I look for kids friendly restaurants and this on fits the bills. The prices are so reasonable and don't forget the bottomless fries or salad. Yes salad too. The waitress was so nice and the staff was awesome. Check this place out it rocks!

I am giving this three starts only for today's service.  Brook was very nice and attentive.  She even placed a carryout order for me after the invoice had been paid.  She came and refilled our fries, drinks and checked to see whatever else she could do for us.  Other times here, I can't say the same.  However, other times my visit was not as nice!  Today good though!
I love a good burger and I think they do have some of the best. Service is also great. Fast, and nice atmosphere for family's

I love a good RR burger and fries. What I can't handle is paying the $13 price tag and not getting hot food, prepared to specifications. Unfortunately this chain is going down hill. Maybe the free refills on sides are running them into the ground.  Today the kitchen timing was way off. We waited 30min (at least) for our food and it was not hot, just luke warm. They slathered my ragin cajun with mayo, which I had asked them to leave off. I asked for "lots of pickles on the side" and I received a sloppy ramekin with 3 pickle chips. I played the game and asked for another side of pickles, three more tiny slices came out. I only had the heart to ask for one more additional pickle ration. The server was aware of our disappointment but made no offers to rectify mistakes. There were no managers on the floor. The place was busy, but there was no wait. Quality control was nonexistent. If there weren't 5 of us trying to have a nice lunch before heading to a family activity, I would have sent a couple things back. The check ended up being almost $100, not worth it today. Mediocre at best. Shape up RR.
